review: So far I am not in love with the Fire tv. I wanted to love it but I just like it. It has all the apps of our roku but doesn't seem to be as user friendly. I am also disappointed with the selection of free prime shows amazon offers (I realize that is not a feature of the device but is worth stating) The voice feature is neat but certainly not enough to make me buy this over a roku. It was easy to set up, it works fine, and it is sleek looking- but there is just nothing super ground breaking about it or that sets it apart from its competitors.
author: JHolland

review: Received this as a gift. Wanted to like it...but lame search functions and I miss all of my Apple apps and iTunes functionality. Sent it back and got Apple TV instead.  More refined, and with an upgrade coming later this year...I'll be a happy camper!
author: David

review: Love it, although wish it had HBOGO and the Showtime anytime would let you choose Charter network....I'm a showtime subscriber but the choice is not available.
author: c.ponce

review: Love the ease of it. Voice activation great, music awesome
author: lse

review: No native DLNA.. So I bought two Roku's.
author: trokon Dougan

review: Not a fan -Sure; one can play cell phone games on it, and it will bring you Amazon videos. What about the content I already have, or paid for a download to my computer? My decades old music library? Do I need to buy all these things again, but now from Amazon? As others have noted, search is a major pain - and what is this "predictive buffering" all about. Sounds like it's just a way to keep my internet more bogged down for other devices. I gave mine away after a few days - may try it again in a few years, if it's still around.
author: Frank Gibson

review: FireTV does not work in hotels (or any place else)  that requires you to enter a name and room number for access. It took my 40 minutes to force FireTV support to admit this. When I tried to complain to customer support, they transferred me back to FireTV tech support????After one horrific hour,  I am printing the return label. ChromeCast for 1/3 the price works just fine.
author: Henry J. Sprafkin

review: It's fast and convenient and it's great that I can watch Amazon movies in addition to netflix. Still lacking in apps though. I would LOVE to see Google Play Music app on here. Maybe they don't want to support the competition, but I would really enjoy having it available.
author: NOLAgirl

review: Box started to cause problems after two months.  Eventually stopped working.  Overall, would suggest that one would stay away from the Amazon Fire TV box.  Waste of money!
author: CA

review: Great TV box. Could have a few more apps. Has enough though. Pandora radio app is really nice on it. Lots of programming available on Prime. More on netflix. This unit really shines when you subscribe to multiple services. The fire tv unit itself it great, very responsive and easy to navigate. Dissapointed that virtually all TV series on Prime are pay per view like iTunes. Kinda like it teases you: "here I am but you can't have me unless you buy me."  I'm used to Netflix where its all included in your monthly charge.
author: MICHAEL W MARQUIS
